page.title: 01Cabus Scorton and District
page.content: Cabus,Scorton and district. Because it is on level,well_drainedland,between coastal marshes and Pennine uplands,all major routes to the NORTH of N.W.England pass through Cabus.The original Chester_Carlisle road,now the A6 Trunk,followed by the Preston_Kendal canal,the L.M.S.railway andtheM6 motorway.Pennine roads meet at Scorton before joining A6.Scorton is a true village community with churches shops and Village Hall but Cabus is a parish without church or school so local activities centre on its Village Hall.Land_use is almost wholly agricultural with related services but the roads bring tourists and caravanners and the canal has boatmen,fishermen and canoists.s
